Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: constipated \constipated\ adj. having difficult or incomplete or infrequent evacuation of the bowels; costive. [WordNet 1.5]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Constipate \Con"sti*pate\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Constipated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Constipating}.] [L. constipatus, p. p. of constipare; con- + stipare to crowd together. See {Costive}.] 1. To crowd or cram into a narrow compass; to press together or condense. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
Of cold the property is to condense and constipate. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
2. To stop (a channel) by filling it, and preventing passage through it; as, to constipate the capillary vessels. [1913 Webster]
3. (Med.) To render costive; to cause constipation in. [1913 Webster]
constipated adj : have difficult or incomplete or infrequent evacuation of the bowels [ant: {unconstipated}]
